item.title: flexaJ add a quote by Arkady Strugatsky
item.description: "Мы будем делать Добро из Зла, потому что его больше не из чего делать." -- Arkady Strugatsky

item.title: flexaJ add a quote by А. Стругацкий
item.description: "Вы спрашиваете: Что считаю Я наивысшим счастьем на земле? Две вещи: Менять вот так же состоянье духа, Как пенни выменял бы я на шиллинг...." -- А. Стругацкий

item.title: flexaJ add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: flexaJ add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: flexaJ add a quote by Thomas Lovell Beddoes
item.description: "If there were dreams to sell, what would you buy?" -- Thomas Lovell Beddoes

item.title: flexaJ add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The Guide says there is an art to flying", said Ford, "or rather a knack. The knack lies in learning how to throw yourself at the ground and miss." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: flexaJ add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Big Brother is Watching You." -- George Orwell

item.title: flexaJ add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Writing a book is a horrible, exhausting struggle, like a long bout with some painful illness. One would never undertake such a thing if one were not driven on by some demon whom one can neither resist nor understand." -- George Orwell

item.title: flexaJ add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: flexaJ add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: flexaJ add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "If my doctor told me I had only six minutes to live, I wouldn't brood. I'd type a little faster." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: flexaJ add a quote by Lewis Carroll
flexaJ add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "This is how humans are: We question all our beliefs, except for the ones that we really believe in, and those we never think to question." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: flexaJ add a quote by Samuel R. Delany
item.description: "The only important elements in any society are the artistic and the criminal, because they alone, by questioning the society’s values, can force it to change." -- Samuel R. Delany

item.title: flexaJ add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "Remember, the enemy's gate is down." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: flexaJ add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "All the stories are fictions. What matters is which fiction you believe." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: flexaJ add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "Love is finding that the things you like best about yourself are not in you at all, but in the person who completes you" -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: flexaJ add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: flexaJ add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: flexaJ add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "Human: That's stupid. Isn't there grass on both sides?" -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: flexaJ add a quote by George Lucas
item.description: "No! Try not. Do, or do not. There is no try." -- George Lucas

item.title: flexaJ add a quote by Lynne Truss
item.description: "Thurber was asked by a correspondent: "Why did you have a comma in the sentence, 'After dinner, the men went into the living-room'?" And his answer was probably one of the loveliest things ever said about punctuation. "This particular comma," Thurber explained, "was Ross's way of giving the men time to push back their chairs and stand up." -- Lynne Truss

item.title: flexaJ add a quote by R.A. Salvatore
item.description: "No, I would not want to live in a world without dragons, as I would not want to live in a world without magic, for that is a world without mystery, and that is a world without faith." -- R.A. Salvatore

item.title: flexaJ add a quote by Raymond Chandler
item.description: "Technique alone is never enough. You have to have passion. Technique alone is just an embroidered potholder." -- Raymond Chandler

item.title: flexaJ add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "All good books are alike in that they are truer than if they had really happened and after you are finished reading one you will feel that all that happened to you and afterwards it all belongs to you: the good and the bad, the ecstasy, the remorse and sorrow, the people and the places and how the weather was. If you can get so that you can give that to people, then you are a writer." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: flexaJ add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "All animals are equal, but some animals are more equal than others." -- George Orwell

item.title: flexaJ add a quote by Joy Harjo
item.description: "I know I walk in and out of several worlds each day." -- Joy Harjo

item.title: flexaJ add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: flexaJ add a quote by John Fowles
item.description: "There are many reasons why novelists write but they all have one thing in common a need to create an alternative world." -- John Fowles

item.title: flexaJ add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "You know how writers are... they create themselves as they create their work. Or perhaps they create their work in order to create themselves." -- Orson Scott Card
